_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The six things that can't be done [an6.9: A person accomplished in view can't take conditions to be permanent
A person accomplished in view can't take conditions to be happiness
A person accomplished in view can't take conditions to be self
They can't do deeds with fixed result in the next life
They can't fall back on purification through noisy, superstitious rites
They can't seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
